extension.dc:title: Species Distribution
extension.name: Distribution
extension.dc:description: Geographic distribution of a taxon. Replaces version issued 2020-07-15 to match latest release of the Darwin Core standard.

property.name: locationID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the set of location information (data associated with dcterms:Location). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

property.name: locality
property.dc:description: The specific description of the place. Less specific geographic information can be provided in other geographic terms (higherGeography, continent, country, stateProvince, county, municipality, waterBody, island, islandGroup). This term may contain information modified from the original to correct perceived errors or standardize the description.

property.name: countryCode
property.dc:description: The standard code for the country in which the Location occurs. Comments: Recommended best practice is to use an ISO 3166-1-alpha-2 country code.

property.name: lifeStage
property.dc:description: The age class or life stage of the biological individual(s) at the time the Occurrence was recorded. Comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

property.name: occurrenceStatus
property.dc:description: A statement about the presence or absence of a Taxon at a Location. Comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

property.name: threatStatus
property.dc:description: Threat status of a species as defined by IUCN: https://www.iucnredlist.org/resources/categories-and-criteria

property.name: establishmentMeans
property.dc:description: Statement about whether an organism or organisms have been introduced to a given place and time through the direct or indirect activity of modern humans. Comments: Recommended best practice is to use controlled value strings from the http://rs.tdwg.org/dwcem/ controlled vocabulary designated for use with this term. For details, refer to https://doi.org/10.3897/biss.3.38084

property.name: degreeOfEstablishment
property.dc:description: The degree to which an Organism survives, reproduces, and expands its range at the given place and time. Comments: Recommended best practice is to use controlled value strings from the http://rs.tdwg.org/dwcdoe/ controlled vocabulary designated for use with this term. For details, refer to https://doi.org/10.3897/biss.3.38084

property.name: pathway
property.dc:description: The process by which an Organism came to be in a given place at a given time. Comments: Recommended best practice is to use controlled value strings from the http://rs.tdwg.org/dwcpw/ controlled vocabulary designated for use with this term. For details, refer to https://doi.org/10.3897/biss.3.38084

property.name: appendixCITES
property.dc:description: The CITES (Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora) Appendix number the taxa is listed. It is possible to have different appendix numbers for different areas, but "global" as an area is also valid if its the same worldwide

property.name: eventDate
property.dc:description: The date-time or interval during which an Event occurred. For occurrences, this is the date-time when the event was recorded. Not suitable for a time in a geological context. Comments: Recommended best practice is to use a date that conforms to ISO 8601-1:2019.
property.examples: "1963-03-08T14:07-0600" (8 Mar 1963 at 2:07pm in the time zone six hours earlier than UTC). "2009-02-20T08:40Z" (20 February 2009 8:40am UTC). "2018-08-29T15:19" (3:19pm local time on 29 August 2018). "1809-02-12" (some time during 12 February 1809). "1906-06" (some time in June 1906). "1971" (some time in the year 1971). "2007-03-01T13:00:00Z/2008-05-11T15:30:00Z" (some time during the interval between 1 March 2007 1pm UTC and 11 May 2008 3:30pm UTC). "1900/1909" (some time during the interval between the beginning of the year 1900 and the end of the year 1909). "2007-11-13/15" (some time in the interval between 13 November 2007 and 15 November 2007).

property.name: startDayOfYear
property.dc:description: The earliest integer day of the year on which the Event occurred (1 for January 1, 365 for December 31, except in a leap year, in which case it is 366).
property.examples: "1" (1 January). "366" (31 December), "365" (30 December in a leap year, 31 December in a non-leap year).

property.name: endDayOfYear
property.dc:description: The latest integer day of the year on which the Event occurred (1 for January 1, 365 for December 31, except in a leap year, in which case it is 366).
property.examples: "1" (1 January). "32" (1 February). "366" (31 December). "365" (30 December in a leap year, 31 December in a non-leap year).

property.name: source
property.dc:description: Source reference for this distribution record. Can be proper publication citation, a webpage URL, etc.
property.examples: "Euro+Med Plantbase - the information resource for Euro-Mediterranean plant diversity (2006-). Published on the Internet http://ww2.bgbm.org/EuroPlusMed/ July, 2009"

property.name: occurrenceRemarks
property.dc:description: Comments or notes about the Occurrence.

property.name: datasetID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the set of data. May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to a collection or institution.
